author: TRD Staff
title: Adams pal steeered city lease to mayorâ€™s donor: sources
text: A longtime aide to Mayor Eric Adams awarded a lucrative lease to a prominent mayoral donor, reportedly overriding the results of a competitive bidding process earlier this year. Jesse Hamilton, New Yorkâ€™s deputy commissioner of real estate services, stepped in to give the lease to billionaire Alexander Rovt after another landlord, AmTrust Realty, had won the bidding to provide office space to the cityâ€™s Department for the Aging, several sources [told Politico](https://www.politico.com/news/2024/10/23/jesse-hamilton-eric-adams-city-lease-deal-donor-billionaire-00185118). Hamilton instructed his staff at the Department of Citywide Administrative Services to halt communications with AmTrust, asserting that Department for the Aging commissioner [Lorraine CortÃ©s-VÃ¡zquez](https://www.linkedin.com/in/lorraine-cortes-vazquez-50a829a/) favored moving her agency to Rovtâ€™s 14 Wall Street. The deal was worth tens of millions of dollars. A spokesperson for the agency referred the publicationâ€™s questions about the lease to DCAS. AmTrust Realty also declined to comment. Hamilton is a longtime pal and mentee of Adams, who was [indicted](/new-york/2024/09/26/mayor-eric-adams-indicted-on-corruption-charges/) in September on unrelated bribery charges. The city had been seeking a new location for the Department for the Aging since before Adams became mayor in 2022. The agencyâ€™s employees work across seven non-contiguous floors in a century-old building near City Hall. Rather than renovating, which the city deemed too expensive, the agency proposed moving, which brought Hamiltonâ€™s division at DCAS into the picture. That division controls 22 million square feet worth of leases with private landlords. [City procurement rules](https://www.nyc.gov/assets/mocs/downloads/Regulations/PPB/PPBRules.pdf) usually prohibit city employees from interfering when the city issues a request for proposals. It is not clear whether those rules applied to this particular transaction, and neither DCAS nor City Hall has provided clarification. Hamilton has a long history with Adams. The mayor had tapped Hamilton as his successor when he left the state Senate to run for Brooklyn borough president. Hamilton lost the seat four years later, but Adams, as mayor, hired him as a DCAS lawyer before elevating him to his current role. Hamilton is one of several mayoral officials under investigation as part of a probe into the cityâ€™s leasing of commercial properties. His phone was recently seized by the Manhattan district attorneyâ€™s office as he returned from a personal trip to Japan. Agents also confiscated the phones of several others on the trip including Ingrid Lewis-Martin, a prominent Adams adviser, and Cushman and Wakefieldâ€™s [Diana Boutross](/new-york/2024/10/11/cushman-broker-diana-boutross-phone-seized/), a commercial broker who works with DCAS on leases. It is not known if the 14 Wall Street lease is part of that investigation. A spokesperson for District Attorney Alvin Bragg declined Politicoâ€™s request for comment. Hamiltonâ€™s reported intervention in the DFTA lease benefited Rovt, a billionaire real estate investor, health care entrepreneur and longtime Adams donor. Rovt and his wife both gave the legal maximum of $3,850 to Adamsâ€™ campaigns in 2013 and 2017, while Rovt gave between $5,000 and $20,000 to a nonprofit Adams oversaw as Brooklyn borough president, according to records Politico [obtained](https://www.politico.com/states/new-york/city-hall/story/2021/04/22/how-eric-adams-official-charity-boosted-his-profile-ahead-of-mayoral-run-1377468). Rovt and his son have donated a combined $3,500 to Adamsâ€™ 2025 re-election campaign. The Rovt family has also given $15,000 to Adamsâ€™ legal defense trust as federal investigators probed the mayorâ€™s ties to Turkish diplomats and businesses. Reached by phone by Politico for comment, Rovt declined to answer questions. After Hamilton overruled the bidding, the Rovt deal went through a public review. A Manhattan community board recommended approval, but later expressed concerns after reporting by [The City](https://www.thecity.nyc/2024/10/11/adams-real-estate-jesse-hamilton-commercial-leases/) drew attention to Rovtâ€™s ownership of the building, his past support of Adams, and Hamiltonâ€™s role overseeing leasing. On Oct. 16, a day after receiving the boardâ€™s letter, the City Planning Commission, which is controlled by the mayor, approved DFTAâ€™s lease at 14 Wall Street. The third layer of approval could prove a harder bar for the contract to clear. The City Council has authority to call the lease up for review, and can reject it via a two-thirds majority vote. Read more Politics New York Investigators seize phone of Adams official who oversees city real estate Politics New York Adams pleads not guilty in bribery scandal Politics New York Eric Adams faces prison. Does real estate have his back? Council member Lincoln Restler, chair of the Councilâ€™s Committee on Governmental Operations, has scheduled a hearing next week on DCAS leasing, and [co-authored a letter ](https://www.politico.com/f/?id= 192-baf8-ddf8-a996-fefe1b090000)with fellow Council member Christopher Marte seeking more information on DCASâ€™ process for identifying commercial leasing opportunities. â€œThe allegation that Jesse Hamilton unilaterally and improperly steered a lucrative city lease to a donor of the mayor is extremely disturbing,â€ Restler said in a statement. â€œNew Yorkers deserve an administration free of corruption and I hope there will be a swift investigation by appropriate authorities that leads to real accountability.â€ â€” Caroline Handel

author: Persistence Market Research
title: Blow-Fill-Seal Technology Market to Expand at 5.9% CAGR Through
text:
Blow-Fill-Seal Technology Market to Expand at 5.9% CAGR Through 2032, Driven by Demand for Aseptic Packaging Solutions 07-31-2025 06:20 AM CET | Health & Medicine
Press release from: Persistence Market Research Blow-Fill-Seal Technology Market
Overview of the Blow-Fill-Seal Technology Market
The global Blow-Fill-Seal (BFS) technology market is set for significant expansion, growing from US$ 3.2 billion in 2025 to approximately US$ 4.7 billion by 2032, representing a robust CAGR of 5.9% during the forecast period. This growth is largely propelled by increasing demand for sterile, unit-dose packaging across the pharmaceutical and healthcare industries, particularly in ophthalmic and respiratory therapies. As consumers and regulators favor contamination-free and preservative-free drug delivery formats, BFS emerges as an optimal solution due to its aseptic, automated packaging process.
Get a Sample PDF Brochure of the Report (Use Corporate Email ID for a Quick Response): https://www.persistencemarketresearch.com/samples/35526
North America currently dominates the market, driven by its mature pharmaceutical infrastructure and regulatory compliance. However, Asia Pacific, especially India and China, is emerging as the fastest-growing region due to expanding pharmaceutical manufacturing capabilities and a surge in local and export demand for low-cost, high-volume BFS applications. Among product segments, vials and ampoules lead the market, largely due to their usage in injectable medications and biologics, while polyethylene-particularly LDPE and HDPE-remains the leading material type due to its moldability, recyclability, and compatibility with sterilization techniques.
âœ¦ Key Highlights from the Report
âœ¦ BFS technology market projected to reach US$ 4.7 billion by 2032 with 5.9% CAGR.
âœ¦ Vials and ampoules dominate as leading product segments for sterile injectable drugs.
âœ¦ Polyethylene materials, especially LDPE and HDPE, hold the largest market share by material.
âœ¦ North America leads due to advanced pharmaceutical infrastructure and regulatory frameworks.
âœ¦ Asia Pacific shows highest growth rate, driven by India and China's expanding pharmaceutical output.
âœ¦ BFS is increasingly adopted in biologics and nutraceuticals due to its aseptic, scalable nature.
ðŸŒ Market Segmentation
The Blow-Fill-Seal Technology Market can be segmented based on product type, material type, and end-user applications.
In terms of product type, vials and ampoules stand out as the fastest-growing and most widely adopted formats. These containers are particularly effective for unit-dose sterile injectable drugs, ophthalmics, and biologics, offering both contamination control and precise dosing. Their small volume, tamper-proof seal, and compatibility with parenteral administration make them a preferred choice for pharmaceutical manufacturers.
By material type, polyethylene dominates the market, with LDPE preferred for ophthalmic and pediatric formulations due to its softness and transparency, while HDPE is widely used for injectables owing to its strength and barrier properties. These materials are compliant with global regulatory standards and are ideal for sustainable, recyclable packaging initiatives.
When considering end-users, pharmaceutical companies lead the demand curve, leveraging BFS for sterile production of antibiotics, vaccines, and biologics. Contract manufacturing organizations (CMOs) and nutraceutical manufacturers are also increasingly integrating BFS due to its flexibility, scalability, and reduced contamination risks.
Read More In Detail: https://www.persistencemarketresearch.com/market-research/blow-fill-seal-technology-market.asp
ðŸŒ Regional Insights
North America
North America remains the largest regional market for BFS technology, holding around 31% of the global share. Its growth is underpinned by a sophisticated pharmaceutical industry, tight FDA regulations, and early adoption of aseptic packaging technologies. BFS is widely used for respiratory and ophthalmic therapies, injectable biologics, and pediatric liquid medications. The presence of leading BFS system manufacturers and CDMOs further enhances regional growth.
Asia Pacific
Asia Pacific is the fastest-growing regional market, with an impressive 8.2% CAGR forecast during the analysis period. Countries like India and China are spearheading growth by expanding pharmaceutical manufacturing bases, investing in sterile packaging solutions, and producing cost-effective generic injectables. The increasing focus on BFS packaging for oral rehydration salts, pediatric medicines, and respiratory therapies contributes significantly to regional expansion.
Europe
Europe commands a substantial share of the BFS market due to its stringent regulatory framework and high precision in pharmaceutical manufacturing. The region emphasizes eco-friendly and recyclable materials, aligning with EU sustainability goals. Countries like Germany, France, and Italy lead adoption for ophthalmic and pediatric formulations, injectables, and nasal vaccines. Post-Brexit, the UK is expanding domestic BFS lines for hospital and pediatric medicines.
âš–ï¸ Market Drivers
The BFS market is witnessing momentum due to the increasing demand for automated aseptic packaging. The core advantage of BFS lies in its ability to form, fill, and seal containers in a single sterile process, significantly reducing contamination risks. This is particularly critical for biologics, respiratory, and pediatric formulations that require preservative-free packaging. The rising global prevalence of chronic diseases, coupled with vaccine distribution drives, boosts BFS adoption.
Furthermore, technological advancements in BFS machine automation, such as high-throughput systems and remote monitoring, enhance productivity and reduce downtime. Governments and private firms are investing heavily in BFS infrastructure to prepare for future pandemics and accelerate biologics distribution.
â›”ï¸ Market Restraints
Despite its advantages, the BFS technology market faces several regulatory and technical challenges. Compliance with stringent aseptic processing regulations set by authorities like the FDA and EMA necessitates heavy investments in validation, environmental monitoring, and cleanroom operations. These factors increase operational costs and delay time-to-market.
In addition, the material limitations of BFS, particularly concerning gas and moisture barrier properties, restrict its use in certain sensitive biologics. Most BFS containers are made from polyethylene or polypropylene, which lack advanced protective capabilities required for complex drugs. Smaller firms also face barriers due to the high cost and technical complexity of BFS machinery, limiting broader market adoption.
âœ¨ Market Opportunities
Opportunities abound as BFS evolves into a scalable solution for next-generation pharmaceuticals. Increasing demand for sterile, unit-dose packaging in nutraceuticals, biologics, and liquid food products creates new avenues for growth. BFS aligns with global sustainability trends, offering recyclable packaging formats and reducing the need for preservatives.
Rapid healthcare infrastructure development in emerging markets, particularly in Asia Pacific, supports the installation of new BFS lines. Innovation in materials, such as bio-based polyethylene, and integration of smart packaging technologies (e.g., QR code traceability) are expanding BFS applications. BFS is also gaining traction in contract packaging, opening doors for third-party logistics and CMOs.

Recent Developments
In August 2024, Nephron Pharmaceuticals collaborated with Rommelag to launch a new BFS line for IV bottles, aimed at resolving drug shortages and expanding sterile packaging capacity.
In November 2023, Unither Pharmaceuticals announced a US$80 million investment to expand BFS production lines, supporting global demand for sterile unit-dose drugs.
Conclusion
The Blow-Fill-Seal Technology Market is on a strong growth trajectory, driven by the global push for sterile, automated, and sustainable packaging solutions. As healthcare standards evolve and biologics gain prominence, BFS systems offer unmatched advantages in safety, efficiency, and scalability. While regulatory challenges and material limitations persist, innovations in bio-based polymers, machine automation, and contract manufacturing are reshaping the industry. With increasing investments and expanding applications across pharmaceuticals and nutraceuticals, the BFS market is set to play a pivotal role in the future of aseptic drug delivery and packaging.

author: MADDY LONG mlong@journalnet.com
title: Valley Mission launches fundraising campaign to finish roof so people in need will have shelter this winter | APG State News | idahopress.com
text:
POCATELLO â€” Valley Mission is asking the community for assistance in its fundraising campaign to finish its roof during this time of frigid temperatures and falling snow.
According to a news release from Valley Mission, the fundraising goal for the project is $40,000. Thanks to a matching gift, every donation will be matched dollar-for-dollar up to $5,000 per donation.
Karl Pettit, acting director of Valley Mission, located at 442 N. Arthur Ave. in downtown Pocatello, said in the news release that it is important the roof be completed as soon as possible so Valley Mission will be able to be a shelter for people during the winter months.
"This is not just a building," Pettit said in the news release. "It's a beacon of hope for people... who survive in their vehicles, on the streets or in tents during these cold months."
The fundraising campaign to finish the roof is part of the Avenues for Hope Housing Challenge, which will run until the end of this month. Valley Mission hopes to raise $200,000 during the challenge to fund several projects such as its emergency overnight shelter, food pantry and medical clinic.
Valley Mission has currently raised $18,130 out of its $200,000 goal. They are hopeful that the community will come together to help them raise more.
Do you LOVE local news? Get Local News Headlines in your inbox daily. Yes! Include special offer& contest announcement emails Thanks! You'll start receiving the headlines tomorrow! Valley Mission helps people who are struggling in life move to a more stable and prosperous future.
There are currently around 100 people in Pocatello who sleep on the streets every night. Valley Mission's Street Reach Team works to bring these people food, clothing and hygiene items. They help people meet their immediate needs and they connect them with resources for housing, medical supplies and others services.
Anyone who wants to help Valley Mission with their efforts can either donate, spread the word or volunteer with the organization.
Pettit said in the news release that Valley Mission hopes to create a safe place where lives can be transformed.
"Together we can give our neighbors the gift of hope and a brighter future this holiday season," Petit said in the news release.
Donations can be made at valleymission.org .

author: Peter Barr and John Dobson
title: Whale mating 'orgy' off Australian coast a promising sign for southern right species
text: feel good [Peter Barr](/news/peter-barr/102158484)and [John Dobson](/news/john-dobson/10964032) In short: A "whale orgy" off southern WA south highlights the unusual breeding behaviour of the mammals. Southern right whales often breed in groups of up to 20 in waters off the Australian coast. What's next? Mating is a promising sign for whale species still recovering from decades of whaling. A mating frenzy captured on camera off Western Australia's south coast is a promising sign for southern right numbers still recovering from decades of whaling, according to a marine biologist. The footage shot by Albany resident Brett Peake shows a group of about six to seven whales mating in a group. Marine biologist Pia Markovic says the mating ritual is more common in southern rights than other whale species. "You could have five whales there or you could have up to 20 whales," she said. "They look to be rolling over each other and rubbing up against each other, which is pretty typical of whale sex." Mating led by female of species Mating can start with a female southern right putting out a call which travels underwater, Ms Markovich said. "The males will hear that and they'll swim over and, basically, a whale orgy starts," she said. "It's almost like a dance when there's physical stamina, they're agile and it's quite graceful actually." Ms Markovic said the female would lead, with the male "mirroring" her movements. It can lead to male whales fighting for attention. "The males will push and shove, but it's relatively non-violent and they kind of just bump into each other like bumper cars," she said. Mating before migration south Multiple males will mate with one female, creating the best chance of impregnation. Ms Markovic said southern right whales had the largest testicles of any animal on earth. "They can weigh up to 500kg each, so they have one tonne of testicles that are inside their body," she said. The whales migrate along WAâ€™s west coast and can breed in waters from Exmouth to the South Australian border before heading to sub-Antarctic waters. Population rebounding from whaling The southern right population was estimated to be 50,000 to 70,000 in the 1700s, before whaling decimated the population. There were fewer than 300 whales left in the 1920s, according to WWF Australia. The most recent estimate has the population sitting at 3,000 or so. Albany was the last commercial whaling operation in Australia until its closure in 1978. Scientists are tracking southern rights through calcified skin markings on their heads and the population is slowly rebounding from whaling. "It's a lot less than the original pre-whaling numbers," Ms Markovic said. "But by mapping these individuals, scientists are seeing an increase about five or six per cent each year, which is fantastic." ABC Great Southern â€” local news in your inbox ABC Privacy Collection Statement .

author: MTN News
title: Polson Police Department investigating recent gun-related incidents
text: POLSON â€” A separate pair of firearms incidents are being investigated in Polson, one involving gunfire and another a burglary. Law enforcement responded to the Apostolic United Pentecost Church building on 8th Avenue West on December 21, 2023, for reports that gunfire had hit the building. Polson Police Chief George Simpson says officers confirmed the building â€” which was occupied at the time â€” had been hit by gunfire. No injuries were reported. The second incident happened on Christmas Day when Polson officers responded to a burglary alarm at the Depoe Junction pawn shop on Kari Lane. The front doors appeared to have been forced open by a vehicle and the business owner reported that several firearms had been stolen. Chief Simpson says a vehicle used in the theft was later recovered by the CSKT Tribal Police outside of Polson and that guns were found inside the vehicle. Anyone with information about either case is asked to call 406-883-8211 and speak with Captain Mathieu Gfroerer. Information can also be emailed to [mgfroerer@cityofpolson.com](mailto:mgfroerer@cityofpolson.com). â€œAny incident involving gun violence, religious institutions, or firearm theft is of the utmost importance to us and we will continue to vigorously investigate these cases with our law enforcement partners and every resource available to us,â€ Chief Simpson stated. Chief Simpson says both investigations are ongoing and no further information is being released at this time.

author: Biblical Man
title: The Dark Truth - The Biblical Man
text:
Share
"Be not deceived: evil communications corrupt good manners." (1 Corinthians 15:33)
I remember a night several years ago when I was reading through our family Bible with my children. My oldest son suddenly asked a question that left me speechless: "Dad, why do people say Billy Graham was such a great preacher if he didnâ€™t preach the true Gospel?"
Out of the mouths of babes comes wisdom that cuts straight to the bone.
The Uncomfortable Reality of Graham's Legacy
Seven years have passed since Billy Graham's death, and while the world still venerates him as America's preacher, it's time we face some hard truths. As a Bible teacher and someone who believes in rightly dividing the word of truth, I've spent years studying the fruit of Graham's ministry. What I've found might shock you.
1. The Descent into Universalism
Graham's latter years revealed a troubling shift toward universalism. In a stunning 1997 interview with Robert Schuller, Graham claimed even Muslims and atheists could be part of the Body of Christ without knowing Jesus's name. This flies directly in the face of our Lord's words: "Jesus saith unto him, I am the way, the truth, and the life: no man cometh unto the Father, but by me." (John 14:6)
2. The Finney Factor
Like Charles Finney before him, Graham popularized the "altar call" methodology. Having witnessed countless altar calls myself, I can tell you: walking an aisle and muttering a prayer doesn't equal salvation. True conversion requires godly sorrow and repentance.
3. The Political Compromise
Despite his public image, Graham was a lifelong Democrat who defended abortion in cases of rape and incest. As a father of five, I cannot fathom justifying the taking of innocent life for any reason.
4. The Watered-Down Gospel
Graham emerged from fundamentalism only to create a diluted version of evangelicalism that pleased the world but grieved the Spirit. Godly men like Martin Lloyd-Jones and Ian Paisley opposed him for good reason.
5. The Globalist Agenda
Few know that Graham was instrumental in pushing for a one-world religion through the World Council on World Evangelization in Lausanne, Switzerland. This should alarm any Bible-believing Christian.
6. The Modern Legacy
Today, the evangelicals who admire him most and run institutions bearing his name represent the most liberal wing of Christianity. The Billy Graham Association even started Christianity Today, which has become a voice for compromised doctrine.
7. The Fruit Test
"Wherefore by their fruits ye shall know them" (Matthew 7:20). Post-mortem studies of Graham's crusades reveal a sobering truth: very few "converts" showed lasting fruit of salvation through church membership, baptism, or continued faith.
Why This Matters Now More Than Ever
As I drive my garbage route through rural North Dakota each morning, I see churches filled with people who've been lulled into a false sense of security by watered-down gospel messages. They're spiritual descendants of Graham's compromised evangelicalism.
The TRUE gospel demands:
- Belief in Jesus as the ONLY way of salvation
- Genuine repentance from sin
- Rejection of all false means of salvation
- Trust in Christ alone, not in works
A Call to Action
Brothers and sisters, it's time to:
1. Return to the pure, uncompromised Word of God
2. Reject the world's approval-seeking Christianity
3. Stand firm on biblical truth, even when it costs us
Remember, "Enter ye in at the strait gate: for wide is the gate, and broad is the way, that leadeth to destruction, and many there be which go in thereat" (Matthew 7:13).
Will you stand with truth, or continue down the broad way of compromise?
Share
